share on x jun 14 at 8:19 pm footprints bracelet was purchased for the family of shawkeet hindi. share on x ke kathy, fred, kelly, justin, amy, jason, ava, carson, and emmalyn. jun 14 at 7:51 pm kathy, fred, kelly, justin, amy, jason, ava, carson, and emmalyn purchased the arms of the angels sympathy basket for the family of shawkeet hindi. share on x db david barton. jun 14 at 6:27 pm shawkeet was a good friend to me at sandia labs since 1963. everyone felt special around him. he allowed me to do my brush lettering on his sprint car in his garage in 1972. that was a good time for me to get acquainted with his wife lois and the boys. he was a special man and a christian man. dave barton. comment share comment share facebook twitter share on x bc bill cunnnghamjun 14 at 5:37 pm lois so sorry to hear of your loss thoughts and prayers are with you...... bill & barb cunninghamcomment share comment share facebook twitter share on x lh linda harvel. jun 14 at 5:19 pm lois, i was so saddened to learn of your dear shawkeet's passing. there are so many memories from speedway park, and i will always remember his kindness to sherrill and myself at the class reunion. may god comfort and bless you and your family at this very sad time. linda lippert harvel1 comment share comment share facebook twitter share on x tw truman west. jun 14 at 11:01 am shawkeet ; was a mentor to me he taught me a lot about racing , racing engines he taught me how to live on the road on a cup of coffee and a bag of beef jerky, i really had some fun times racing with him , when we pulled in people knew they had to get their "a" game on the "flyin arab" was in the house . he truly was a great man and one of my hero'scomment share comment share facebook twitter share on x er edie roche. jun 14 at 10:42 am shawkeet and bill roche were the best of friends for many years. they shared a passion for sprint car racing that included many trips to dirt tracks around the country. they swapped stories about these trips that the rest of us could only surmise to be true. they couldn't make this stuff up!! like, eating supper at a 7-11, or coonass food in louisiana, or tommy estes' "launchers", all the good times they shared with their friend vern schubarth. the three musketeers! they were the happiest when they were knee deep in mud at a race track. my most heartfelt sympathies to lois and their children. he will be deeply missed by all who knew him. he was one of the good guys. love, edie roche and family. comment share comment share facebook twitter share on x fr fred raether. jun 14 at 9:13 am i have known shawkeet for many years. i worked for his father in-law jack arnold before i was hired at sandia. my brother david raether also worked for him in the print shop at sandia. shawkeet was a fair and honest man to work for. he made an impact at sandia that was admired by allot of people. i truly enjoyed talking to him any time i could. he always kept me up about jack because he knew i liked and respected him. i am very saddened by his passing and will keep your family in my prayers. fred raether. comment share comment share facebook twitter share on x more
